Key Match Events: Tyler Herro and Jaime Jaquez Jr. each drained key free throws in the waning moments as Miami improved to 2-1 on its six-game trip.
Post-Match Reflections: Neither team shot well, with the Jazz making 39.8 percent of their shots and the Heat shooting 39.6 percent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz started strong, taking a 20-10 lead when Markkanen dropped in a 3-pointer.Miami surged back and held a 46-41 halftime lead by holding Utah to 14 points in the second quarter.The Heat went up by 11 points after opening the third quarter on a 10-4 spurt.Markkanen hit back-to-back 3-pointers in an 8-0 Utah run to tighten things up.The Heat scored six straight midway through the fourth to go ahead by four.Adebayo then hit two shots in a row, Jaquez nailed a 3 and Herro sank two free throws.Jaquez put Miami up by five by sinking two foul shots with 11.8 left to clinch the win.
